title: Can someone use my name to write a letter without my permission? - Quora

response.answer_text: Of course, however that would depend on the use & content of the actual letter. For example, school children write notes “from their parents” all the time. They know it's wrong, but suits their agendas. In the case of a legally binding document, it would be illegal to do so, like signing another person's name on a cheque, and punishable by law. Hoping this is helpful.

If someone writes a letter pretending to be you and signs your name (i.e., not someone who happens to have the same name), this could well be forgery or fraud. This depends on the totality of the circumstances. This is not legal advice. If you want legal advice, you should consult a lawyer and explain al of the facts in detail.
